answers.author: Wendy Roberman
answers.text:
Hi Pam, 
I live in the City of Charlottesville, VA and am participating in their "Neighborhood Leadership Institute" class, which is exactly what you're asking about.  This is their 4th year of doing it and it's great; i highly recommend it.  Contact Jim Tolbert at:  http://www.charlottesville.org/   I've attached a short blurb that was in the City newsletter last fall.  Let me know if you want to know more about my experience.  Wendy

answers.author: Lana Hygh
answers.text:
The Town of Cary, NC has been conducting citizen academy, School of Government, since 2003.  It is limited to 24 participants so that we can provide time for Q&A as well as hands-on activities.  Additional information is available on our website at http://www.townofcary.org/Departments/Administration/Town_Manager_s_Office/School_of_Government.htm.

author: Pamela Muse
text:
The City of Phoenix, AZ is looking for information from other cities that have set up a City Hall 101 type program - holding meetings or classes with members of the public to teach them more about how different departments and functions work at the City of Phoenix; how the city operates.  We would appreciate any documents or emails describing the programs.
Allison Mehr
City of Phoenix
Marketing Partnership Program
602-495-0189
allison.mehr@phoenix.gov
title: Citizen Meetings/Classes - City Operations
